newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-JUVENTUS, DORTMUND AND UNITED REACH SEMIFINALS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JUVENTUS, DORTMUND AND UNITED REACH SEMIFINALS.

text.p: European champions Juventus will meet either Atletico Madrid or Ajax in one semifinal, while Manchester United will play Borussia Dortmund in the other semifinal of the European Cup next month.
Juventus clinched their place in the last four with a 2-0 home win over Rosenborg Trondheim of Norway for a 3-1 aggregate quarter-final victory on Wednesday.
The opening goal of the game was scored by Frenchman Zinedine Zidane in the 29th minute with Nicola Amoruso wrapping it up with an 88th minute penalty.

Juventus will have to wait until later to find out who their opponents will be. Atletico and Ajax were playing extra time in their quarter-final second leg after a 1-1 draw in regulation time. The tie was balanced at 2-2 on aggregate.
Manchester United, protecting a 4-0 first leg advantage, drew 0-0 in Porto to reach the semifinals of the competition for the first time since 1969.
They will play Borussia Dortmund in the last four after the Germans won 1-0 at Auxerre thanks to a 59th minute goal from Lars Ricken to win the tie 4-1 on aggregate.
The semifinals will be played on April 9 and April 23 with the draw on Friday deciding which clubs are at home in the first leg. The final is in Munich on May 28.
